Our Bible Verse for Today:
"What shall I do, then, with Jesus who is called Christ?"
Pilate asked...(Mt. 27:22)

Our Lesson for Today:
Some questions I can't answer. Like what the year 2020 will bring.
Other questions I may refuse to answer. Like what my Social Security 
number is when cashing a check. to still other questions I may shrug 
my shoulders because they don't interest me...

his hands...

disciples answered by running away in fear, though after Easter they all 
found the right answer...

choose eternal damnation instead of the eternal life He offers...

Dear Lord, through the power of Your Word give me
the strength to answer: "He's my only Savior. There's 
only one thing, I want to do with Him. Believe Him. 
Confess Him. Follow Him all the way to heaven...Amen.

Your Word in my heart that I may use them when I

Our Bible Verse for Today:
I tell you, her many sins have be forgiven ~
for she loved much...(Lk. 7:47)

Our Lesson for Today:
Some words in the Bible are difficult to understand. For example,
How would you define eternity? Or though the Bible doesn't actually
use the word, how would you explain the concept of the Trinity? Now
what about the word forgive?

The people of Jesus' day thought they understood what this word meant
until they saw Jesus in action. Like the time when He was dinning at the 
house of Simon the Pharisee...

While they were at the table, a woman with a sinful reputation slipped
into the room. She washed Jesus' feet with her tears, dried them with 
her hair, and anointed them with expensive oil...

She was kneeling at the feet of her Savior. With her actions she was 
showing how much His forgivingness meant to her...

Of course Simon objected thinking Jesus should have sent her away. 
But Jesus doesn't treat people the way we do...

He doesn't just show love to those He thinks deserve it. He offers His forgiveness
to all. He gives it to sinners, not because they deserve it but because they
need it...

His love reaches out to all people, even me. I don't deserve even an ounce of it.
Jesus' forgiveness brings me joy, even though I can't begin to understand the
love behind it...

Prayer Suggestion:
Thank you Lord, for the love that forgives me.
Help me treasure it though I can't understand 
it...Amen.

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

11/05/09~~~food for thought~~~LIFE NOW...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
I write these things to you who believe in the name of the
Son of God so that you may know that you have eternal life.
(I Jn. 5:13)

Our Lesson for Today:
"Life" insurance doesn't really insure life. It provides benefits when I die, 
but those benefits go to others, not to me. I keep paying the premiums
so others may receive when I die...

Jesus is true life insurance for me. His policy promises not a cash benefit
but life that never ends. That benefit doesn't come to my survivors but to me.

The best of all is that I don't have to die before I first collect."You have eternal life,"
the apostle writes in our verse. Right now eternal life is mine. From the moment
God's Spirit, through the gospel, works faith in my heart, I'm eternally alive...

Membership in the heavenly Father's family, assurance of protection from Him as 
His child, and the sure promise of a permanent home in His heaven are mine to
enjoy now. I don't have to wait till I die to receive the benefits of this wonderful
life insurance...

I can cash it in and benefit every day. What a difference that makes in my life...
Are you worried about the premium? God's Son paid it in full....

That's why I can be sure about eternal life. Jesus with His life and death and
resurrection, paid for me the total cost for the life that never ends. Kneeling
in faith beneath his cross, I can say, "I know that I have eternal life, beginning
right now."

Prayer Suggestion:
Thank You, Lord, for paying the premium. Help me
enjoy eternal life right now...Amen.

Our Bible Verses for Today:
He has rescued us from the dominion of darkness and brought us 
into the kingdom of the Son He loves, in whom we have redemption, 
the forgiveness of sins...(Col. 1:13, 14)

Our Lesson for Today:
Paul in our verses writes of the most amazing rescue mission ever.
Souls were lost in sin's darkness. The fires of damnation were ever 
drawing the whole human race...

Mankind had only one way to go, that was into an eternal hell. even 
though sinners tried to save themselves by their good works, they
were still being drawn in by the flames of hell...

Though they pretended all was well, they slipped faster and faster down
the slippery slop. The inevitable end was death ~ eternally lost to hell's
fire...

So a loving God launched his rescue team of One, It was His Son whom
He loved. That Son left the safety of heaven for earth. He braved the
worst storms that hell could devise to pay for all the sins of all mankind...

He even died on God's rescue mission. But the third day He rose again
to show that redemption was there for all. No longer do sinners have to
continue down the slippery slope into hell...

They can live forever in a storm~free heaven. But only through the forgiveness 
God's Son has won for them. More than heroism, this rescue mission required 
love as only God could give...

More than reading about this mission, I'm a part of it. God's Son has rescued
me. I thank God for the faith by which I know this...

Prayer Suggestion:
I pray that the God of love who rescued me through His
Son keep me safe till I reach heaven...Amen.

11/07/09~~~food for thought~~~MORE THAN ENOUGH GRACE...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Where sin increased, grace increased all the more...(Ro. 5:20)

Our Lesson for Today:
No matter how tall my mountain of sin becomes, God's mountain of grace
stands taller that He built on Calvary. I dig the pit of punishment for my sin 
so deep that, lying on its bottom, I can't even see the top. But God's hand 
of grace is always long enough to reach down to me...

I earn death over and over again as the wages for my sins till I'd have to
spend a zillion years in hell if eternity had time. But God's grace always
has more than enough to cover my enormous debt. I simply cannot outsin His Grace...

But I dare not let such a thought encourage me to sin all I want. Rather, 
God's more-than-enough grace is my comfort when I do fall into sin. Each
night when I pray on my pillow, "Forgive my sins," I don't have to add,
"If they aren't too many for Your grace."

When my final night comes on this earth, I don't have to worry, "Are some 
of my sins still there, not covered by His grace." No God's grace is always 
more than enough to cover all my sins...

Prayer Suggestion:
Lord, comfort me with the assurance that Your plenteous grace
covers all my sins...Amen.

11/08/09~~~food for thought~~~HE'LL FINISH THE JOB...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Being confident of this, that He who began a good work in you
will carry it on to completion until the day of Christ Jesus...(Phil. 1:6)

Our Lesson for Today:
What if my remaining in faith depended on me? What if God were to tell
the believer, "There, I brought you to faith, now you are on your own to
keep your faith ticking"?

Some people actually think that, that is the way it is. They even think faith 
is something they can preserve. Sometimes they even go so far as to claim,
"Once a believer always a believer."

Notice where Paul put his confidence. He pointed to God."He's the one
who began a good work in you," he told his readers. Just as with salvation,
so with faith. It's God's good work. He makes the unwilling willing...

He opens sealed hearts. He dynamites out unbelief and plants faith. Faith
is God's good work in my heart...

Notice also who Paul said would carry my faith to completion. Again it is God.
He won't quit with the job half done. He'll continue to assure me that Jesus is
my Savior till Christ comes to take me with Him in heaven...

Though faith's creation and continuance are God's workings, He does remind me
through what faith comes. It is the power of His gospel in Word and sacrament.
He expects me to use these mighty means faithfully. When I do, He gives my faith
the staying power it needs...

Prayer Suggestion:
Lord, keep me close to Your gospel through which
You refuel my faith for heavens flight...Amen.

11/09/09~~~food for thought~~~HOW DO YOU MEASURE GOD'S GRACE...

Our Bible Verses for Today:
I pray that you...may have power...to grasp how wide and long 
and high and deep is the love of Christ, and to know this love
that surpasses knowledge...(Eph. 3:17-19)

Our Lesson for Today:
What tape measure can I use for God's love? My mind simply can't stretch far 
enough to measure the width, length, height, and depth of God's love...

How do I measure a love that sacrificed His Son for undeserving me?
What numbers should I write down for a love that left heaven behind to
come to earth? That took the world's sin on holy shoulders to Calvary's cross???

That caused the eternal One to breath His last on that cross all for my salvation? 
My mind can't measure more than the first few inches of this love's dimension...

Such love surpasses knowledge. But thanks be to God He doesn't ask me to 
measure His love, He merely asks me to believe in it. Only God's Spirit, as He 
works through the gospel, can power my heart to believe what my mind cannot measure...

I can only marvel and thank God for His love for me...

Prayer Suggestion:
Holy Spirit, draw me into the Word so that I may understand
more fully and appreciate God's love...Amen.

wanted to be but because my parents wanted me. I was born the second time,
not because I wanted to be but because God wanted me...

Thank God for His grace in making me twice born.

Thank You, Lord, for the new birth into faith in Jesus
through Holy Baptism...Amen.

them all forgiven...

by the precious blood of Your Son, Jesus...Amen.

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Whether we live or die, we belong to the Lord...(Ro. 14:8)

Our Lesson for Today:
Life is at best uncertain. When I leave the house in the morning, who 
knows whether I'll make it back at night. When I lay my head on the pillow, 
who knows if I will wake up in the morning. Though my health seems to 
be good at the moment, who knows when sudden illness can strike...

And yet life is most certain. As Paul put it, "We belong to the Lord."
He bought me with His Son's blood. He has made me His own dear child 
with His gift of my faith. He has reserved a room for me in His heavenly mansion. 
He knows when it's time to take me home to that room. One thing I can be sure 
of as His treasured possession. I can't lose because I belong to Him...

I can't lose while He still leaves me here. The days which lie ahead may have 
more storm clouds than sunshine. The devil with his temptations may be 
hitting me where I'm weakest. Sin may be swamping my boat of life faster 
than I can bail. But I can not lose...

Practical people like 21st-century Americans think more about the here

think about things like Christ's coming. Otherwise it is business as usual 
as I muck around on this ball of mud...

when He comes. He wants to find us sweeping the sky with the radar of faith,
watching and waiting for Him...

Lord, keep me awake and watching for my Savior's return
so I can follow Him to glory...Amen.

Our Bible Verses for Today:
If He comes suddenly, do not let Him find you sleeping.
What I say to you I say to everyone; "Watch!" (Mk. 13:36, 37)

Our Lesson for Today:
How often while leaving on a trip have you wondered if you forgot something?

What about packing for Christ's return? When He comes, there'll be no time 
to jump out of bed and reach for the suitcase. When the only Savior of the sinner 
stands at the door of our life, it won't work to say "Just a minute while I pack."

The suddenness of His coming will make the split second of an accident or the 
surprise of the first labor pain seem hours long in comparison. All at once He'll 
be at our door. We need to be ready before He comes, or we'll never be ready 
when He does come. Now when our heart still beats and our world still turns, 
is packing time for eternity...

So what do we need in our suit case? What should we not forget? 
Only one item ~ Christ Jesus, the all sufficient Savior."Believe in the Lord Jesus,
and you will be saved, Scripture reminds us in (Acts 16:31).

This requires constant packing. We need regular use of the gospel in Word and
sacrament for the Holy Spirit to keep the Savior packed in our heart. No we can't
pack it once and set it in the closet. This Advent season when to Savior gives you 
a poke in ribs, "I'm coming," He is reminding you, "Is your bag packed for heaven?"

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, you've give me Jesus, Please keep Him in my heart
always through Your Word...Amen.
